title: Of the Wicked which eat not the Body of Christ in the use of the Lord's Supper
text: The wicked and such as be void of a lively faith ... though they do carnally and visibly press with their teeth ... the sacrament ... yet in no wise are they partakers of Christ ...
commentary: Article 29, “Of the Wicked which eat not the Body of Christ in the use of the Lord's Supper”, states: The wicked and such as be void of a lively faith . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
